components.description:
A cartoon-styled gust of air. Depicted as a small, gray cloud with motion lines, rushing to the left.

Resembles briffits, a stylized cloud of dust used in comics and animation to indicate someone or something has dashed away (e.g., leaving someone in the dust).

May be used to represent speed, smoking, and various types of wind, blown or broken. May precede other emoji, such as üèÉRunner or üöó Automobile, to indicate something is fast or fleeing: üèÉüí®, üöóüí®.

Not to be confused üå¨Ô∏è Wind Face, though their applications may overlap.
components.title: Dash Symbol

description:
A cartoon-styled gust of air. Depicted as a small, gray cloud with motion lines, rushing to the left.

Resembles briffits, a stylized cloud of dust used in comics and animation to indicate someone or something has dashed away (e.g., leaving someone in the dust).

May be used to represent speed, smoking, and various types of wind, blown or broken. May precede other emoji, such as üèÉRunner or üöó Automobile, to indicate something is fast or fleeing: üèÉüí®, üöóüí®.

Not to be confused üå¨Ô∏è Wind Face, though their applications may overlap.
title: Dash Symbol

version.description:
Released in October 2010, Unicode 6.0 was the first version of the Unicode Standard to support emoji.

Some characters in prior versions of Unicode were retroactively updated to provide an emoji presentation. This release was the first to introduce new characters for the sole purpose of compatability with emojis being used in Japan.

emoji_net_data.category: Miscellaneous Symbols And Pictographs -> Comic style symbols
emoji_net_data.definition: A gust¬†of air, representing the fast movement of a person or object to the left of this character.¬†Can be used in combination with another e http://emojipedia.org/dash-symbol/
emoji_net_data.name: dashing away

bn:00102802a: Acting or moving or capable of acting or moving quickly
Characterized by speed; acting or moving quickly.

bn:00083652v: To exhale visibly through the spout the seawater which it has taken in while feeding.
(of a cetacean) exhale visibly through the spout the seawater.

bn:00093939v: To inhale and exhale the smoke from a burning cigarette, cigar, pipe, etc.
To inhale and exhale smoke from a burning cigarette.
Inhale and exhale smoke from cigarettes, cigars, pipes
To inhale smoke from for example a cigarette or a cigar.

bn:00088689v: To breathe noisily, as when one is exhausted.
Breathe noisily, as when one is exhausted

bn:00084007v: To emit digestive gases from the anus; to flatulate.
To emit digestive gases through the anus.
To emit digestive gases from the anus, especially with accompanying sound.
Expel intestinal gases through the anus
To expel gases generated during digestion, especially through the anus; to fart or flatulate.

bn:00002216n: Wind, while simply "the flow of air or other gases that compose an atmosphere," has since ancient times been a significant and pervasive metaphor and symbol in human discourse.
Wind is the flow of gases on a large scale.
The motion of air relative to the earth's surface; usually means horizontal air motion, as distinguished from vertical motion.
Air currents can be caused by differences in temperature, pressure, or impurity concentration.
Real or perceived movement of atmospheric air usually caused by convection or differences in air pressure.
Flow of gases or air on a large scale
Air moving (sometimes with considerable force) from an area of high pressure to an area of low pressure

bn:00035120n: The emission of digestive gases through the anus.

Flatulence is defined in the medical literature as "flatus expelled through the anus" or the "quality or state of being flatulent", which is defined in turn as "marked by or affected with gases generated in the intestine or stomach; likely to cause digestive flatulence".
The state of having gas, often malodorous, trapped (and often released, frequently with noise) in the digestive system of a human and some other animals; wind; and when released, a flatus, a fart.
Bodily function of expelling intestinal gas out of the anus
A state of excessive gas in the alimentary canal
An emission of digestive gases from the anus; a flatus.

bn:00036806n: The visible vapor/vapour, gases, and fine particles given off by burning or smoldering material.

Solids in the air that have been generated by the condensation of vapors, chemical reactions or sublimation (a direct change from solid to gas). Often metallic oxides or metals, these particles are less than 1 micrometer in diameter and may be toxic.

Smoke is a collection of airborne solid and liquid particulates and gases emitted when a material undergoes combustion or pyrolysis, together with the quantity of air that is entrained or otherwise mixed into the mass.
A cloud of fine particles suspended in a gas
An aerosol, consisting of visible particles and gases, produced by the incomplete burning of carbon-based materials, such as wood and fossil fuels.
A gas or vapour/vapor that smells strongly or is dangerous to inhale.
Mass of airborne particulates and gases

A gas or vapour/vapor that smells strongly or is dangerous to inhale. Fumes are solid particles formed by condensation from the gaseous state, e.g. metal oxides from volatilized metals. They can flocculate and coalesce. Their particle size is between 0.1 and 1 micron. (A micron is one millionth of a metre)
